item.title: Keyboat Layouts for Xorg & TTY
item.description: This guide will lead one in following fields: Figure out possible available layouts, change layouts either temporarily or permanently, Alter layouts in Xorg or in TTY. Requirements: xorg, xorg-setxkmap, root access (doas/sudo/su). Xorg: Keyboard Layouts and Variants For Xorg layouts and variants and explanations is located in a text file: /usr/share/X11/xkb/rules/evdev.lst. After the decision of layout, it is recommended to pick a variant for preferred layout. E.g. for German, de, picking German (dead acute) will be de deadacute.

item.title: Starting out with Hugo
item.description: Download hugo, using pacman in this example. Check official website for other ways.1 pacman -Sy hugo Create a new website. Configuration file uses toml by default, yml format is possible with appending -f yml to below command. hugo new site my-website Download a theme and initialize it. cd my-website git init git submodule add git-link-here themes/theme-name Set the theme on toml file. printf "theme = "theme-name"\n" >> config.toml Change your settings inside config.
